title: Do you ever just want to rush the story ahead and write the 'great plot' you thought of? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think some people believe that a story has to be written in chronological order. Often, when I have a really good scene in my head, I write that - even if it’s not in the right order or it’ll be a few chapters ahead of where I am. It helps keep the idea fresh and the motivation rolling. If I have a great idea for a scene, there’s no sense waiting for the scene to actually happen in the plot. Just write it now and fill in the gap later (as long as you make a note that you’ve created a gap, ha!).
Yes and I often do it. There’s no rushing of the story, though — the plot is already there. It operates as the engine of the story from the first word.
